channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Anthropic’s safety first approach won over big business—and how its own engineers are using its Claude AI
item.description: Anthropic engineers mostly use Claude for debugging, not writing new software, but they worry about deskilling

item.title: UN warns about AI becoming another ‘Great Divergence’ between rich and poor countries like the Industrial Revolution
item.description: “We believe we need more balance, less hysteria and hype,” said Philip Schellekens, the UNDP's chief economist for the Asia Pacific.

item.title: Exclusive: Billionaire Michele Kang launches $25 million U.S. Soccer institute that promises to transform the future of women’s sports
item.description: Women are not just "small men"—and Kang's efforts will target everything from treating women's injuries to preventing girls from dropping out of youth...

item.title: Costco sues Trump, demanding refunds on tariffs already paid
item.description: In a complaint with the U.S. Court of International Trade, Costco demanded money back “to ensure that its right to a complete refund is not jeopardize...

item.title: How Kalshi’s Cofounder Went From Professional Ballerina To World’s Youngest Self-Made Woman Billionaire
item.description: A former ballerina and MIT computer science grad, 29-year-old Brazilian Luana Lopes Lara is now the world’s youngest self-made woman billionaire.

item.title: Sabrina Carpenter rips ‘evil and disgusting’ White House use of one of her songs in an ICE raid video montage
item.description: "Do not ever involve me or my music to benefit your inhumane agenda.”

item.title: Reagan And Koop Confronted AIDS. Trump And RFK Jr Ignore It
item.description: December 1 was World AIDS Day. For the first time since this global event was established in 1988, the United States government declined to observe it...

item.title: Here’s Where Drivers Suffer The Worst Traffic Congestion, Data Shows
item.description: Commuters in several of the nation’s metro areas now endure some of the most crowded highways on the planet.

item.title: Some Social Security recipients to receive 2 monthly benefit checks in December
item.description: SSI recipients will receive two Social Security payments in December 2025 due to a calendar scheduling quirk that moves January's payment to Dec. 31.

item.title: Apple Silicon: Key Execs Reveal How The Mac And iPad Were Revitalized

item.title: FBI Warns Gmail And Outlook Users—Do Not Click On These Emails
item.description: Hackers are stealing millions of dollars — do not become their next victim.

item.title: Musk says AI and robotics are 'only' things that can solve massive US debt crisis
item.description: Elon Musk claims AI and robotics are the only solution to America's $38 trillion debt crisis, predicting dramatic economic changes within three years.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
